properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 2:45PM CST until February 6 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Tulsa OK
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM LIKELY WEDNESDAY...

.Moderate to heavy sleet and snow is forecast to affect the
region beginning late tonight and continuing through Wednesday
evening across much of east central and northeast Oklahoma as a
strong low pressure system moves across the region.

* WHAT...A wintry mix of light snow, sleet, and freezing rain will
likely spread into eastern Oklahoma and northwest Arkansas late
tonight into Wednesday morning. Total snow and sleet accumulations
of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of one to two tenths of
an inch possible through Wednesday evening.

* WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast Oklahoma and
northwest Arkansas.

* WHEN...From 3 AM Wednesday to midnight CST Wednesday night.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

In Arkansas, for the latest road conditions call 1-800-245-
1672 or go to idrivearkansas.com. In Oklahoma, for the latest
road conditions call 1-844-465-4997 or go to okRoads.org.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM WEDNESDAY TO MIDNIGHT CST WEDNESDAY NIGHT
